pr_title: docs: add note for java client CP pom

timeline.message: docs: add note for java client CP pom

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  available at `http://packages.confluent.io/maven/`, by replacing the repositories
          
          
            
                  from the [Confluent maven repo](http://packages.confluent.io/maven/) by replacing the repositories
timeline.author: JimGalasyn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -103,6 +103,12 @@ Start by creating a `pom.xml` for your Java application:
 </project>
 ```
 
+!!! note
+      If you’re using ksqlDB for Confluent Platform (CP), use the CP-specific modules,
+      available at `http://packages.confluent.io/maven/`, by replacing the repositories

replies.bodyText:
Hey @JimGalasyn , does hiding the URL behind the text "Confluent maven repo" make the note harder to use, in reference to "replacing the repositories in the example POM above with a repository with this URL instead"?
I'm happy with your suggestions if you think it's better -- just wanted to point out my original motivation for leaving the URL visible.
replies.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: Ah I get it! Generally we want URLs to be hot, so we could have the best of both worlds by changing the link text to the URL:  http://packages.confluent.io/maven/. How does that sound?
replies.author: JimGalasyn

replies.bodyText: The best of both worlds indeed! I'll make the updates. Thanks!
replies.author: vcrfxia
 ```
